content: Hey, I'm Christian. My primary language is C++, but I'm also good with several others (C,C#, Python, etc). I haven't had a chance to work with nontrivial Rust code, but I'm super interested in compilers and related theory, and so I was interesting in helping out, in whatever way I can. I'm not totally sure where to start, but from the projects I've seen, rustc, miri, and chalk seem fairly interesting to me.
There's https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/ and some "good first issues" tagged on GitHub. I'll also plug rust-analyzer, it's pretty nice to contribute to :-).
